      • getSpatialOrientationProjection

        public double[] getSpatialOrientationProjection(ISimulationObject realObject)
                                         throws UnknownPropertyNameException
        Description copied from interface: ISpatialPropertyHandler
        returns the 2d projection of the heading, pitch, roll orthogonal vectors. this information can be computed using the orientation but that depends upon having more information than most clients have access to, so this info can be provided by the sensor.

        These are the angles made by the projection of the orthogonal axes to 2d space. Specifically: heading-pitch, heading-roll, and pitch-roll.

        What's the point? heading-pitch of a person's head will tell us the direction they are looking mapped onto the retina, which provides a depth-free (and therefor noisey) estimate of where they are looking

        Providing this information is entirely optional. There may be no array at all, or the array may contain Double.NaN for any value it does not provide
        Specified by:
        getSpatialOrientationProjection in interface ISpatialPropertyHandler
        Returns:
        Throws:
        UnknownPropertyNameException
